issue.title: INVOKE(f, t1, t2, ... tN) and INVOKE(f, t1, t2, ... tN, R) are too similar

discussion.p: The distinction between INVOKE(f, t1, t2, ... tN) and INVOKE(f, t1, t2, ... tN, R) is too subtle. If the last argument is an expression, it represents tN, if it's a type, then it represents R. Very clumsy.
Proposed change: Rename INVOKE(f, t1, t2, ... tN, R) to INVOKE_R(R, f, t1, t2, ... tN) and adjust all uses of this form. (Approximately 10 occurrences of invoke would need to change.)
